intro: Hamosa atratiformis, commonly known as the silky hamosa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
